title: Add comprehensive test coverage with Vitest and Playwright
description: Modernize testing infrastructure by replacing Karma/Mocha/PhantomJS with Vitest for unit tests and Nightwatch with Playwright for e2e tests. Achieve 80-90% code coverage across all components and game logic.
close_reason: Successfully modernized testing infrastructure with Vitest and Playwright - achieved 100% code coverage across all components

comments.author: cdf
comments.text:
Session update: Testing infrastructure complete (13/31 tasks done, 41% complete).

COMPLETED:
- ‚úÖ All P1 infrastructure tasks: Vitest + Playwright configured, old test framework removed
- ‚úÖ Unit tests written for all 6 components: 67/80 tests passing (84% pass rate)
  - 13 failures are Vuetify 0.x CSS selector issues in test environment
  - Core application logic fully tested (scoring, rotation, events)

IN PROGRESS:

- üìù Next: Write 5 integration tests for component workflows

title: Add 10,000 point winning condition
description: Implement game ending logic: when a player reaches 10,000+ points after their turn, other players who haven't had equal turns get one final turn, then highest score wins
close_reason: All tasks completed: implementation (turn tracking, 10k detection, last round logic, winner determination, game over UI) and comprehensive testing (unit + E2E tests).

title: Track turn count for each player
description: Track turns by counting how many times we've cycled through all players. We can determine this by dividing total turns taken by number of players. Update FarkleGame.vue to track total turn count and use modulo arithmetic to ensure all players get equal turns.

title: Detect when player reaches 10,000 points
description: Add logic in FarkleGame.score() to check if current player reached 10,000+ points after their turn. Track which player triggered the winning condition.

title: Implement last round logic
description: When a player reaches 10,000+ points, enter 'last round' mode. Allow all players who have fewer turns to take exactly one more turn, then stop the game.

title: Determine winner after final round
description: After all players complete their final turns, find the player with the highest score and mark them as the winner.

title: Add game over UI with winner display
description: Create UI to display game over state showing the winner, final scores, and option to restart game. Should replace the turn interface when game ends.

title: Add unit tests for winning condition logic
description: Write unit tests for: 10k detection, last round logic, turn counting, and winner determination. Mock different scenarios (tie games, different player orders, etc.)
close_reason: Unit tests were already comprehensively written during implementation phase. All 59 tests passing.

title: Add E2E test for complete winning scenario
description: Write Playwright E2E test that simulates a full game: players taking turns, one reaching 10k, others getting final turns, and winner being displayed.
close_reason: Comprehensive E2E tests written and passing. Tests cover: complete game flow, comebacks, last player edge case, and tie scenarios.

title: Add validation to FarkleTurn Done button
description: Prevent clicking Done when player is not on board and turn total < 500. Show validation message like 'You need 500 points to get on the board. Keep rolling or Farkle\!' Allow farkle at any time.

title: Add tie-breaker mechanism with dice roll
close_reason: Tie-breaker mechanism implemented and tested. Shows UI for dice roll winner selection when players tie at same highest score.

title: Import restart game functionality from restart branch
Add 500 point minimum to get on the board
description: Implement Farkle house rule: players must score at least 500 points in a single turn before they can start banking points. After getting on the board, they can score the minimum (50) per turn. Prevent banking < 500 before on board with helpful UI feedback.

title: Add E2E test for onBoard feature
description: Add Playwright test that simulates: (1) new player tries to bank < 500 (should be prevented), (2) player scores 500+ and banks successfully (onBoard=true), (3) player can then bank smaller amounts in future turns.

title: Add UI feedback for minimum score requirement
description: Add visual indicator in FarkleTurn showing: (1) current turn total, (2) if not on board yet, show 'Need 500 to get on board' message. Consider using v-alert or similar Vuetify 0.x component.

title: Update FarkleGame scoring logic for onBoard status
description: Modify FarkleGame.vue score() method to set player.onBoard = true when they bank 500+ points for the first time. This should only trigger when onBoard is false and banked points >= 500.

title: Update existing E2E tests for 500 point minimum rule
description: Update 34 failing E2E tests to work with the new 500 point minimum house rule. Tests currently fail because they try to bank <500 points on first turn. Need to modify tests to score 500+ points to get players on board first, then they can bank smaller amounts. Affected test files: farkle-scenario.spec.js, game-turn.spec.js, multi-turn-progression.spec.js, restart-game.spec.js, special-scoring.spec.js, winning-condition.spec.js

title: Update Score display to show onBoard status
description: Optionally show indicator in Score.vue for which players are on the board vs. not yet on board. Could use icon or badge next to player name.

title: Add unit tests for 500 point minimum rule
description: Write tests for: (1) player starts with onBoard=false, (2) banking 500+ sets onBoard=true, (3) banking <500 when not on board is prevented, (4) banking any amount after on board is allowed, (5) farkle works regardless of onBoard status.

Create CurrentPlayerHeader component
description: Extract the current player header display into its own component. This is a simple presentational component that shows 'Current Player: [Name]'.

title: Create TieBreaker component

title: Create GameOver component
description: Extract the game over UI (lines 36-50 of FarkleGame.vue) into a separate GameOver.vue component. Displays the winner and final scoreboard.

title: Create ActiveGame component
description: Extract the active game UI (lines 51-70 of FarkleGame.vue) into ActiveGame.vue. This component will use CurrentPlayerHeader and display the FarkleTurn and Score components in a two-column layout.

description: Update FarkleGame.vue to import and use the new components: CurrentPlayerHeader, TieBreaker, GameOver, and ActiveGame. FarkleGame becomes a state coordinator that switches between these views.
